revised_title: Principles and Factors Governing Deep Groundwater Flow
tldr: This article discusses the principles and factors that govern deep groundwater flow, focusing on the Canadian research program for waste disposal in the Precambrian rocks of the Canadian Shield. The author explains how the general character of groundwater flow is dominated by surface topography and the decreasing hydraulic conductivity with depth. The article also highlights the importance of understanding the crucial factors to devise indirect techniques for reliable estimates of groundwater flow and its consequences.
